concise_definition: n. 彻底失败, 失败的作品; v. 彻底失败, 崩溃

definitions.explanation_en: A complete and often public failure, especially of a performance, product, or venture that was expected to succeed.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一项本应成功却彻底失败的表演、产品或事业，通常伴随着公众的失望或嘲笑。
definitions.example_en: The new Broadway musical was a flop, closing after only three performances.
definitions.example_cn: 这部新百老汇音乐剧惨遭失败，仅上演三场便被迫停演。

definitions.explanation_en: A person or thing that fails to meet expectations or performs poorly, often in a humorous or ironic way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一个未能达到预期或表现糟糕的人或事物，常带有幽默或讽刺意味。
definitions.example_en: He was considered a flop as a teacher but became a bestselling author later.
definitions.example_cn: 他当老师时表现糟糕，但后来却成了畅销书作家。

definitions.explanation_en: To fail completely, especially in a sudden or noticeable way, often after high expectations.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指彻底失败，尤其在高期望之后突然或明显地崩溃。
definitions.example_en: The movie flopped at the box office despite its star-studded cast.
definitions.example_cn: 尽管这部电影明星云集，票房却惨败。

definitions.explanation_en: To fall or drop heavily and limply, often with a slapping sound.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指沉重而无力地倒下或落下，常伴有拍打声。
definitions.example_en: The tired dog flopped down on the rug and fell asleep.
definitions.example_cn: 那只疲惫的狗瘫倒在地毯上，睡着了。

comparison.analysis: “Fail” (失败) 是一个通用词，泛指未能达到目标，程度可轻可重。而 “flop” 特指彻底、戏剧性的失败，常带有公众关注和强烈反差，语气更强烈、更口语化。
“Bomb” (惨败) 是俚语，常用于娱乐行业，指演出或电影彻底失败，与 “flop” 意义高度重叠，但 “bomb” 更具口语和非正式色彩，常用于美国英语。两者可互换，但 “flop” 更中性通用。
“Collapse” (崩溃) 强调结构、系统或身体的突然瓦解，常用于物理或抽象系统（如经济、健康），带有严重后果的意味。而 “flop” 更多用于项目、表演或个人表现的失败，不必然涉及物理性崩塌。
